HIGHLAND

The high-level streams library for Node.js and the browser.

$ npm install highland

Download Source code

Introduction

Highland is re-thinking the 'JavaScript utility belt' for the Node generation. We have many tools that provide Streams, EventEmitters, Promises, and callbacks, but we lack the language to move seamlessly between them.

Thankfully, there is a deeper abstraction which promises a higher-level of code. Streams, EventEmitters and Promises all represent values in the future. Think of a Stream as an Array, where the values are distributed in time instead of space. With this, we can imagine a general interface for describing operations on any value in the future. If we describe this Stream as lazy, causing the underlying effects when we pull values from it (eg, reading a file), we can also describe patterns of execution and control-flow.

Basically, we're going to stream all the things!
